articles.author: Kate Bartlett
articles.title: Africa's oldest leader isn't ready to retire — and he's not the only one defying age - NPR
articles.description: At 92, Cameroon's President aul Biya is running for an eighth term on Sunday — a reminder of how Africa's aging leaders continue to cling to power, even as their nations face unrest, corruption, and calls for change.
articles.content: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa After a newspaper reported in 1897 that the great American writer Mark Twain had died, a bemused -- but very much alive -- Twain famously quipped: "the report of my death w… [+4639 chars]
